description: This is a very spacious, sunny & beautiful self contained studio with a private courtyard, brand new luxury Queen bed and renovated ensuite!   Perfectly located across from Hagley Park with its Botanical Gardens.  The beautiful Avon River just across the road.  Victoria street is just a short 5-10 minute stroll (most popular/vibrant street in the CBD).  Main bus routes at the doorstep and only 10-15 minutes from the airport.There is plenty of free parking available on the streetThe spaceBeautiful, charming & private self contained studio apartment in the most prime location for travelers.  Please note: parking is on the street only which is free.  Also the hand basin in the ensuite is quite small.  If you are requiring a longer stay, please note that the kitchenette is not a full service kitchen, it doesn‚Äôt have an oven, stovetop or sink.  Further details below:The studio has been renovated recently am yet to update the photos.- Brand new luxury Queen bed- Brand new renovated ensuite- Brand new Heat Pump - Private outdoor patio via french doors with outdoor furniture will allow you to enjoy the sun.- TV, Wifi, Fresh Towels and Linen, soap and toilet roll are all provided.- Comfy Sofa, Dining Table and Chairs are all provided.- Kitchenette comes with: Toaster, mini fridge, Cutlery, Plates, Glasses, Mugs are all provided- Tea & Coffee are also providedNB: Please make sure you read the details of the listing carefully so you are not disappointed.  The bathroom supplies are; hand soap on the vanity, body wash in the shower and fresh towels.  It doesn‚Äôt have mini body washes or shampoo.Please note, this is a studio within an historic villa - it has its own private access and operates independently from the rest of the house.  The house is over 100 years old, it‚Äôs  been tastefully renovated, but has retained many of the charming aspects from the original villa  ie; the hot water can sometimes take a minute to heat up!  So don‚Äôt panic :)This is a mini home away from home and I would like to attract guests that are looking for that homely experience, not a brand new, sterile box.Guest accessYou will have access to a very large self contained studio with brand new private ensuite & private outdoor courtyard.  You will have TV, Wifi and kitchenette which has a Kettle, Toaster, Mini Fridge, Microwave and cutlery/glasses/mugs/plates /bowls etcBrand new luxury Queen Bed with Fresh Linen, Fresh Towels, Toilet Roll and SoapOther things to noteThis is a ground floor apartment so you wont need to worry about carrying your luggage upstairs :)

description: Beautiful big brand new house with your own bedroom and bathroom with shower and bath (bathroom may be shared with another guest from time to time). Myself and Louie the cat are very friendly and welcoming. You have access to your own private living/working extra room if needed. The bedroom is warm, cosy and very comfortable. A lamp, double bed, 32 " TV with Netflix, YouTube and more. Bedside table, towel,  face cloth, linen and soap are provided. Added privacy with a mirror tinted window.The spaceThis room is for 1 person. I have set up my spare bedroom as a separate living/tv/games/media/study room for you to enjoy if you would like your own separate living space. From time to time this may be used as a spare bedroom.Guest accessYou will have access to all areas of my home except my bedroom and own personal ensuite.Other things to noteI have been hosting for many years and Louie the cat and I will make your stay an absolute joy. Our home is your home. We love meeting new people and our home is super homely and very comfortable and spotlessly clean. We have lots of repeat stays which we love, people arrive as strangers and leave as friends. üòä I am also triple vaccinated.

description: The room is a cosy single room with a comfortable king single bed suitable for a single guest. Guests have exclusive use of their own bathroom adjacent to the bedroom. Breakfast of cereal, toast, jams, eggs, tea, coffee etc is provided.  This accommodation is particularly suitable for a quiet guest who is happy to  interact with a local host.The spaceMy home is a beautiful wooden villa, well decorated and warm. The house is a 35 minute walk from the city. Buses to the city leave from a stop 100 metres away. The room is small but airy and has an armchair and space for clothes storage. There is a heater and plenty of spare blankets. A small desk and chair are available if requiredGuest accessGuests have access to the lounge and kitchen. There is a microwave, electric jug, toaster available for use by guests as well as tea, coffee etc.Other things to noteMy home is a dog friendly place- and my Shi Tsu cross dog Alfie is always happy to make guests welcome. Please note that there is no television in the room and nor are electric blankets provided. There is a heater and plenty of bedding available.

description: We aim to offer affordable luxury weekend accommodation, with the modern comfort of a brand new townhouse, nicely tucked away in the back of the development, on the edge of Christchurch City Central (CBD). This is a quiet area with the Avon river walk-way, entry to the red zone park and Pomeroys Pub & Little Poms cafe right on our doorstep. Cathedral Square is about 1km or 15 minute walk away. We are COVID19 vaccinated and ask the same of our guests.The spaceYou'll have a  lovely private room on the ground floor with an en-suite bathroom.  A new queen bed from Ecosa, with a medium-firm mattress & ergonomic pillow and bamboo sheets.  On colder days you may even appreciate the heated toilet seat!Complementary tea, coffee and filtered water and light reading material are available in the room also.Guest accessFree on street parking but it's not a busy street, which means you can unload first and then park either on our street, around the corner or in a quiet parallel street very nearby. Christchurch Central is flat, so easy to get around on foot, Lime e-scooter or Uber/Lime e-bike.Other things to noteWe are proud to live a such an ever evolving city, surrounded by cafes, restaurants, bars and other wonderful venues constantly popping up for you to explore.With the sea and mountains in our backyard so to speak as well, you won't be short of things to do and see.

description: Sunny, self-contained one bedroom apartment in a quiet residential area. Fully furnished with en-suite bathroom (must go via bedroom to bathroom). Warm and cosy with games and books supplied. Nice area with lots of local amenities. Located above our family home. Available for stays of one month or more so ideal for those on exchange trips or for those looking for more permanent accommodation. (Note: Due to insurance requirements, must sign a short-term tenancy agreement for your stay, no bond).The spaceThis flat is sunny, self-contained and has all you need for a home away from home. Quiet and cosy, there are some books and games as well as wifi access. Being upstairs, there are nice views over the Port Hills and Southern Alps (bedroom) and the flat has a nice light feel.Guest accessIt is a self-contained flat (above our family home)with an open-plan lounge, dining and kitchen area. There is a double bedroom with an ensuite bathroom. The guests have sole access to the whole flat and there is a private staircase to the front door of the flat. There is an outdoor clothes drying area reserved for guest use only and there is a set of bins reserved for the flat.

amenities: Hair dryer,Body soap,Hot water,Essentials - Towels, bed sheets, soap, and toilet paper,Hangers,Bed linens,Extra pillows and blankets,Iron,TV with Chromecast,Central air conditioning,Heating,Smoke alarm,Wifi,Dedicated workspace - Guests have a desk or table that‚Äôs used just for working, along with a comfortable chair.,Refrigerator,Microwave,Dishes and silverware - Bowls, chopsticks, plates, cups, etc.,Private entrance - Separate street or building entrance,Patio or balcony,Free street parking,Single level home - No stairs in home
description: My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travellers.The spaceWhat our guests tell us they love about our Air BNB: - own entrance - heat pump/air con- gorgeous bathroom with deep tub- ultra fast unlimited internet- TV with Chrome Cast - own patio in native garden- boardwalk entry with lighting- self check in/out but hosts are on site if needed- many eco features- filtered water system - fridge/microwave/toaster- crockery/cutlery provided - 25 minute walk to city centre- on street free parking - comfy bed with electric blanket - amazing valueKia ora dear guests, we have blocked out Mon-Thursday nights in our booking calendar for the next few months to allow Sandra to have a rest from working 3 jobs. BUT if you have stayed before or are desperate, message us and we will lift the block for the dates you want if we are able to. Awhi mai. Want to know more about our Air Bnb studio?Your accommodation is a fully furnished ground floor ensuite studio in a modern and warm eco designed house in St Albans in a cul de sac. The studio has its own private entry from a boardwalk and has its own patio and is set in a native garden.  You can come and go as you please. Self check in and out.This is a very warm and well insulated house with double glazing, your own heat pump, solar water plus many other eco non-toxic features in a quiet tree lined street close to buses or a 25 min walk from the city centre. (2.5km from Square.)  On street car parking. It is a 15 minute drive or shuttle from the airport and we are just off the main road heading north out of town.The studio has a hotel quality queen bed plus an inbuilt closet with shelves and rails for clothes. Also provided is a chest of drawers, bedside table, lamp plus a table and chairs, TV with Chromecast and a small sofa. The bathroom is perfect for relaxing in with a feature blue glass brick feature wall, separate shower and extra deep tub for soaking. The studio has a fridge, microwave, toaster and kettle so you can keep and make your own breakfast/snacks and reheat food or even cook it in the microwave. Crockery and cutlery provided. Please note there is no full kitchen and only snack/simple meal making facilities are provided in the studio.  A few starter herbal tea bags are provided for a welcome cuppa on arrival but breakfast and milk are not provided. There is a supermarket near by and  a 24 hour garage minimart if you need to grab supplies during your stay.The studio is best for a single person or couple as there is just one queen bed. The house was built to be as non-toxic as possible and has been maintained using environmentally friendly paints and cleaning products. Our water supply is filtered and so free of the chemicals now added to the local water supply. All linen is washed in eco-friendly detergent and sun dried. Please be aware that therefore our linen will not have a laundry detergent fragrance. We compost and recycle as much as possible. The land the house is on is used for growing fruit and vegetables and is managed using veganic and organic principles. It is just a normal suburban garden which has been designed to grow as much as possible and feeds us year round. Please note that this house is in a suburban neighbourhood and is part of a  home. The studio has had sound reduction features added so you should have a quiet stay but is not sound proof. It is possible you may hear noises from other people living in the same building if they are there or noise from the neighbours as one would expect in the suburbs though generally this should not be a problem and if it is, just tell us and if we can, we will try and sort it for you. However if you want a totally silent stay, it might be better to book a rural Air Bnb. Most guests though comment on how quiet it is here.Guest accessGuests have sole use of the studio and bathroom. Entry to the studio is down a wooden boardwalk through a native garden to your patio and door. Self check in.There are no stairs - just one step down to the boardwalk path to access the room and a step up at the end of it. The studio is at ground floor level.Other things to note11am check out. We can sometimes arrange a later check out on request depending on our circumstances and the next booking on that day. Please ask. Weekday 4pm check in.Weekend 1pm check in.We work and usually can't get the room ready for you before 4pm on a weekday or 1pm on the weekend. However if you want an earlier check in,  we will do our best to make it possible if we can. Please let us know if you need this. We almost always have guests the night before and as their check out is 11am, we just can't offer a morning check in sorry. So if you want an early morning check in and be guaranteed that the room is ready for you when you arrive from your long haul flight, we suggest you also book the night before so that the room is definitely available. It is usually no problem to drop off luggage earlier if you need to. Please let us know if you would like to do this. You can check in late no problem. So don't worry if your flight is landing at midnight or even later. We will arrange with you how to access the studio.If you wish to stay long term, we can make the studio available for longer stays than what is available on the calendar. Please contact us with your request.If you wish to stay an extra  night on either side of the available dates, please contact us and we will try to make this possible for you unless the room is already booked. The studio used to be part of the Lonely Planet recommended 'greenSpace Eco B&B'. At that time, our B&B had 3 guest rooms  and was very busy. However  we closed the B&B after the earthquake so as to make rooms available for permanent residents due to Christchurch's housing shortage which is now much better. This time we have decided not to do the whole busy B&B thing again and just have the one room available for guests.
